website_summaries.verdict: This 14-cup maker has a lot to offer, including adjustable temperature to maintain control and brew strength variation technology.
pros: Garners praise for brewing great-tasting coffee with its unique technology capable of maintaining very hot temperatures without compromising flavor
Has a large 14-cup capacity and attractive, modern looks
cons: An occasional leak around the spout of the carafe has been reported
Control buttons and the LED display have been known to malfunction

website_summaries.verdict: A state-of-the-art model that produces quality coffee rivaling that of machines more than twice as expensive.
pros: Features a charcoal water filter and brew strength control for great-tasting coffee
cons: A little bulky, but it is a large-capacity coffeemaker that can make up to 14 cups at once

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Product!
customer_reviews.text: My Cuisinart lasted all but 2 months and 9 days before the water started draining out of the bottom of it and running everywhere all over the counter before you could even hit the start button. Before then, it was difficult to program and get the settings correct as the buttons were glitchy. Apparently, Amazon won't touch it after 30 days so when contacting the manufacturer, they want you to box it up and pay for shipping before they will send a new one, and of course you have to give them your credit card info to pay the shipping to receive a new one! Last Cuisinart product I'll ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: Native Texan

customer_reviews.title: I have loved Cuisinart coffee makers for years but this one is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Cuisinart coffee makers for years but this one is junk. Amazon even replaced the first one I got but the 2nd one did the exact same thing. It overflows the filter every time and get grounds all over the place. You cannot make a full pot of coffee with it or you will have grounds in your coffee every time
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Botsford

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: As of today the tube that runs up to the dripper head, its short rubber hose from the heater coil has a hole in it because the "S" bend is too sharp and is attached to the aluminum heater coil pipe, So heat soak cycles plus the bend caused this. No way to take it apart and fix it either as the internals there are glued together not screwed like previous models. have videos and pictures.way to expensive to not get a year out of it, bought Sept 2017-today Mar 2018. Perhaps a more robust reliability test protocol next time before using new materials, my parents machine did the exact thing 2 weeks ago as well not even year either.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Not a great model...
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this model coffee maker for a tad over a year. Every week, the red “clean me” light would light up, so we cleaned it weekly, until the following week, then the light would show, again. We always used filtered water. We would also brew tea in it, BUT when we would use the carafe to fill the reservoir, apparently there would be water leaking onto the counter top. The base sat almost flush to the counter top, so eventually the bottom plate rusted out. If we’d known, we would have glued tiny silicone pads to raise the bottom to prevent contact with water.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Knight

customer_reviews.title: 14 Cups at 5 Ounce per cup. Misleading!
customer_reviews.text: Be advised that this "14 cup" carafe is @5 oz per "cup". A normal coffee cup is 6 oz. A normal measuring cup is 8 oz. So this carafe hold the same amount as a standard 12 cup carafe. Plus, you might have to adjust the amount of grounds you use accordingly. Other than that, I like this machine.
customer_reviews.author: wed4877

customer_reviews.title: Leaks After 8 months
customer_reviews.text: This has an obvious design flaw that Quisinart surely must know about but just refuses to address. Several people here have complained about the high temperature rubber tube leaking. I had one unit that lasted a few years before it leaked, but the last one only lasted 8 months. The upper high temperature silicone hose that connects the tank to the heating element is very short and the two connections are slightly offset, therefore putting constant strain on the tube which is already stressed because one end connects to the hot metal heating element tube. If you buy this for $100, you would be wise to invest in the $14 four year warranty plan.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Michalek

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Dec 14, 2017, it leaked all over the counter I just called Cuisinart and this model is out of stock and they have no idea when they will be available, therefore for only $10 they will send me one whenever they come back in stock. There are no other option. This coffee pot did not even make it 6 months I have always bought Cuisinart products and they have lasted. I have to go and buy a coffee pot to use until they decide to send me a coffee pot, or I can give up drinking coffee until they send one, or I can just give up coffee all together. Boy am I ticked off.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this Cuisinart appliance and I typically like Cuisinart as a brand. As other reviewers have written, the water compartment is at an awkward angle for filling and the opening is small. The cover of the carafe has to be snapped on and off. It doesn't swing open in place. On the base of the unit, the stainless-colored sides became discolored with brownish, copper stains that don't clean off. I don't think this coffee maker is worth the high price they charge for it.
customer_reviews.author: PhylG

customer_reviews.title: What an AMAZING coffee brewer!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee brewer is the CADILLAC of all brewers! Forget Bunn, forget Hamilton Beach, forget Keurig, and any other brand! I would buy this pot over and over again, and highly recommend it to anyone needing a new brewer. The settings buttons work exactly as specified...for example, if you want warm coffee, you can brew warm coffee. You want piping hot coffee, you get that! The bold button actually brews bold coffee! I need about three more, because they would make amazing gifts!!!! Love, love, LOVE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Kimmel

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October, today in January I woke up to water everywhere in the kitchen. We use the delayed brew feature every day so coffee is ready in the morning. There was water all over the counter, the floor, it had even seeped into the cabinets under the counter. Everything stored in those cabinets that was not in a plastic or metal container is now ruined. This is the first mid-priced coffee maker I have ever purchased and it was definitely a total waste of money. The little cheaper ones last years. This didn't even make it 4 months. Do NOT buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Clark Bremer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier. Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Self identified coffee snob. Couldn't be happier. Easy to operate, functions as advertised, instructions are clear. The metal filter included does what it needs to do. I recommend a relatively course grind (imagine the feel of cornmeal) with the metal filter to get the full flavor of the coffee. If you're a bit of a coffee snowflake (no disrespect intended) and don't like the "mud" at the bottom of the cup, you should stick with the paper filter. Either way, the coffee maker itself does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Marlar

customer_reviews.title: Terrible coffee
customer_reviews.text: Bad coffee. I should have had a clue when the instructions call for only one tablespoon of coffee per cup, half the usual recommendation. Apparently, to compensate for the small amount of coffee used, the brew is very much over-extracted and tastes terrible. Using more coffee produces a richer brew, but it still tastes as if it's been boiled too long.
customer_reviews.author: Al Balmer

customer_reviews.title: How to talk to someone with a problem now about registration and also how will customer service respond
customer_reviews.text: I just spent 1/2 hr trying to register this.the same message was repeated over and over with no help whatsoever ever.If this is how new customers are handled,I think I made a mistake in this coffee pot and maybe should have stayed with a Mr.Coffee instead.i am giving you a negative based on this experience. We just hooked this up yesterday and used it once. So I cannot really say anything about the product
customer_reviews.author: Buggnana

customer_reviews.title: If you take off even one screw, Cuisinart will not honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: The hot water hose on the base cracked apart after a little over a year of use. Water poured out of the base. I took the base off (four screws), and could see immediately that the hose had cracked apart in a spiderweb pattern. It is a rubber, not a silicone hose, and clearly cannot withstand heat generated by the hot water. I took the base off to see if the electronics were wet. They were. This had obviously become a fire hazard. Cuisinart will not supply spare parts (a hose), and it will not honor the warranty because I removed the easy-to-remove base. I will not buy another Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.author: Paco Wang

customer_reviews.title: All good. Would've given it a 5-star rating but I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: All good. Would've given it a 5-star rating but I'm a long-time Cuisenart owner & it's evident that the company's former devotion to quality is a thing of the past. I suspect, like so many others, they just slap their name on other manufacturer's products now, which is a shame. I've had several of these coffee pots over the years & this is the first one where I instantly noticed the reduced quality of the material (cheap plastic, "stainless" surface impossible to keep clean b/c the finish is cheap). Like I said - works great, just not the quality product I've come to expect from Cuisenart
customer_reviews.author: Beez

customer_reviews.title: Heater plate rusting
customer_reviews.text: After about a year and 9 months the heater plate started to rust. I called for warranty service and they said they do not cover rust, I told them this is part of the coffee machine and effects it use they said to clean with vinegar & water, this will probably make it rust faster, and if it shorts out it may cause a fire! I like the coffee machine a lot, what good is a warranty if it does not cover a defect, the heater plate should not rust in less then 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months of use we discovered that this appliance had leaked & damaged the counter top.I'd purchased the 2 year protection plan but because it was still under warranty was directed to contact the manufacturer.They told me that they'd replace it but would be charged ten dollars..After many days the replacement has arrived with instructions to return the defective product, presumably shipping at our cost in addition to the other ten dollars.Hmm.So let's see. Original purchase price for fairly expensive but cheaply made defective product.Subsequent damage.Inconvenience while product replaced.Billed in addition to purchase & expected to incur return shipping cost.I do regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My old Cuisinart coffee maker was awesome. It made terrific coffee and lasted 12 years. Soooo, I had no qualms about replacing it with a new similar model Cuisinart. Well, it made terrific coffee for about two months then one morning I noticed the coffee in the carafe was boiling over. Also noticed a burning plastic smell and the on/off button didn’t work. Needless to say I was really disappointed. I’ll be searching for a replacement and I hope to have better luck with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Great coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart makes a great product. My last one lasted 10 years of constant use. This one offers the option to brew bold and it does seem to brew a richer cup of coffee on that setting. Cuisanart is the one company with a well designed carafe that eliminates dripping or slopping over the edges when I'm pouring my coffee. Setting the clock and time took a bit of reeducation on my part, but after 6 months of constant use I'm happy with this new model. It is also more compact than other units I looked at. In my tiny kitchen that was an added plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this model!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had few cuisinarts. This one is horrible. It has a top you must secure and it takes forever to pour a cup of coffee with it on. When you take it off, it pours better but leaks down the side. It also make an annoying clicking while it’s making. I regret buying this one. Coffee tastes fine but I expect better from this company. I returned the first one thinking something must have been wrong but nope, they both did it. Now I am stuck with it as I don’t have he time or energy to return another one.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product, zero stars I would. First, the design is terrible-it’s almost impossible to pour water into the reservoir without getting it all over the place (forget about using the pot to fill it) and the pot is designed so that you have to almost tip it upside down to pour coffee. Finally, the carafe only keeps your coffee “hot” for up to one hour. I verified this by calling product support where they suggested that I prefix the carafe with hot water to warm it up before. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 years but it is literally built to fail.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 5 years but has a plastic internal hose which runs through the bottom of the unit that is guaranteed to fail at some point. There is no reason to engineer this hose into the unit other that for it to fail at some point. Also, the hose seems to be made inaccessible on purpose. I wouldn't have been able to access it if it weren't for some unusually long needle nose pliers. So, depending on how you feel about planned obsolescence, this is a decent machine, but it is built to break so you will be forced to by a new one, or deal with an incredibly tedious repair.
customer_reviews.author: Ayne

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed with this Cuisinart coffee maker. For the month and a half we had it, it made great coffee. And then it just stopped working. It wouldn’t brew, it wouldn't run the cleaning cycle, it wouldn’t do anything. For the price I paid, I expected a lot better. Fortunately, we hadn’t gotten rid of our ugly 10 year old Black&Decker coffee maker which works fine. I’m just glad the Cuisinart broke within our return window! I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Brew
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for about a week and I could not be happier. Makes GREAT coffee. For those of you that want a full pot brewed in a flash, this coffee maker won't be for you. It doesn't bother me that other coffee makers might brew more quickly, because the quality of the coffee brewed is not acidic or bitter. It does have a Bold button for those of you that like it "thick"! The other feature I like is that it makes 14 cups, vs 10 or 12 like some others. The warming plate can be set on low, medium or high. It's just a great coffee maker, so far. Consumer Reports got it right.
customer_reviews.author: Basket Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee But Started Leaking After 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Cuisinart Coffeemaker. It makes great coffee, easy to use and to clean. After 3 months started leaking. Under warranty but no luck in contacting company. According to their website, we must ship them the product and include $10.00 They will decide if it should be replaced. In the meantime we have no morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Likes To Read

customer_reviews.title: If you like weak coffee buy this.
customer_reviews.text: A14 cup carafe and an 8 cup brewing basket. We purchased 3, 2 as gifts, and so sorry we did. We like strong 💪 coffee and this can't come close to making 14 cups. At best, 8-9 cups. The basket is too small for the carafe. And, the coffee maker takes up a lot of room. A waste of space. The manual states not to grind your beans too fine. This unit is consistent, it overflows at least 50% of the time. I'm not sure how much effort or thought was used on design, but Cuisinart needs to rethink this product. We purchased these based on reviews and past experience with Cuisinart products.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker but cord is too short
customer_reviews.text: Have had several Cuisinart coffee makers and this one is also a good product. Two things different about this one. One is it is taller so needs to be kept further from your cabinets. The other is it has a shorter cord so we had to use an extension cord with it. Bought a 1 foot long extension cord in black to leave on the cord. Would have liked the cord to be long enough like the old models. Their cost reduced cord probably saved them 10 cents and cost me $6.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Sleek design, great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the stainless steel carafe version. My biggest complaint about this carafe is that the opening to clean the inside is too narrow to get your hand inside for a good scrub. It's been over 7 months since the purchase, and every time I make coffee (every day) I'm grossed out by looking at the bottom of the carafe and seeing residue in it. Why wouldn't Cuisinart make it easier to clean?
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Summers

customer_reviews.title: Leaking only a year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was not a cheap coffee maker, yet it started leaking less than a year after we purchased it and we eventually just had to throw it away because most of the water would end up on our kitchen counter and on the floor rather than in the coffee maker. Very disappointed since it had great reviews. We switched to a pour-over so we don't waste our money again.
customer_reviews.author: jktrainer

customer_reviews.title: Beyond worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous model for a few years until it died on me. Not saying I expect this one to last any longer than that one did, but it is such a great coffee maker. The programming is easy, the coffee tastes great, and the option for temperature is a very nice bonus. A lot of people review that this makes the hottest cup without burning, but I happen to like my coffee to not burn my mouth. I set mine to low and it's easily drinkable for me in a couple minutes, 5 minutes for my girlfriend who usually orders her coffee at "kiddie temp" from Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: griz

customer_reviews.title: Quality Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is easily programmable and produces quality coffee. The shower-head style of the water drip gives an even distribution of water over the coffee grounds. The finish is a little obnoxious and the lid on the carafe is poorly designed, but for me these minor complaints aren't enough to warrant a deduction in stars. I definitely got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: MJB

customer_reviews.title: Very good coffee, but cleaning the machine is impossible.
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes very good coffee, but I never would have bought it if I'd known how difficult it was to clean. Once you're done brewing the coffee and lift up the top, everywhere inside is totally covered in coffee grounds, and the problem is that that there are so many hidden and extremely difficult spaces to reach, you can't get to them all to clean it properly. And even though the many small holes under the top are right there, getting all the grounds off from in and around them is impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Consummate Consumer

customer_reviews.title: After less then six months of use the hot plate ...
customer_reviews.text: After less then six months of use the hot plate is pealing apart and the warranty people want me to pay for shipping on a new one . The very fact that they want me to pay shipping really irritates me so I will use this coffee maker until the plate chips more then in the trash it will go . I will also NOT buy another Cuisinart knowing there warranty is a pay one . Below you can see what less than six months of use has done to the hot plate .
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: After 2 weeks, coffee tasted like plastic
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous 12-cup model and after spending more time than I wanted to reading reviews, I decided to "upgrade" and get this one. We ran 20 water-only cycles (we counted) to get the pot used to hot water running and take out the plastic taste some reviewers said they had. After 2 weeks of brewing coffee, no luck. Our coffee had a plastic-like aftertaste and we simply couldn't take it anymore. Returned it. I decided to use our French press -although not as convenient. PRO: the coffee did come out piping hot! That's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love
customer_reviews.text: Even during this Covid-19 crisis, Amazon delivers... I like millions of others who have had to work from home. Gone are the perks of free coffee at the office. So the first thing I did was to find something that will last me through the day. It was important for me to get a stainless steel carafe, the 12 cup capacity is a must too. Super nice looking, and after 3 days of use, no issues. I will update if things change. I got a super great deal for one from Amazon's warehouse that I assume was a return, still came in original box. so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Cullen H Ka

customer_reviews.title: Features And Taste Spot On
customer_reviews.text: Easier than an earlier model in terms of pouring channel with and ability to firmly get the top in. Lots of buttons. I use only the center one. Wish that one were larger or had a different color or dot on top for early morning use. Very fast. Do note this is 14 and not 12 cup. Be sure to measure any upper cabinet clearance. It produces notable steam and will impact cupboards directly above. I like the flavor even after an hour and reheat. So far, the plate doesn’t smell; learned lesson. It needs daily wipe off. If used for fewer than 6, I turn-off now and then rewarm rather than let smaller quantities remain. Good purchase and price.
customer_reviews.author: LGH_UWS

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Snobs
customer_reviews.text: I admit it: we are coffee snobs. Single cup servings are for people who don't care about their coffee. Yes, we live in the Seattle area. This coffee maker (3rd one of this model we have bought over many years) makes a great cup of coffee in a timely fashion. Better than anything one could get at Starbucks or any of the billions and billions of coffee shops we have. And...it is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: wildchinook

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: We are one our fourth one of these things, with each lasting for about one year. My wife and I use it once a day and after about a year they either get plugged up (despite routinely cleaning it and replacing filters) or just quit working altogether. We have tried other coffeemakers and those usually fail even sooner. So, we just decided that instead of trying to relearn different control units we'd just stick with this model. Knowing that they fail I keep a new one in reserve and when the current one goes belly up we just toss it and plug in the backup.
customer_reviews.author: James E. deMin

customer_reviews.title: Better than our previous Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.text: This is a newer version of our old, beloved coffee maker. This one has a charcoal filter option on it which we honestly will use until it runs out and then not replace. If you love BOLD coffee and a coffee maker that is easy to program, this is a great one! Our last one cost us about $99 but this one was on sale for $54 so it was a steal! We will never have another coffee maker other than a Cuisinart again. We used to burn through Keurig machines about every 8 months. Completely satisfied and we use this every day.
customer_reviews.author: El Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I trust the Cuisinart brand. Never has a coffee maker functioned so poorly within such a short amount of time. Within three months, the drip stop function didn't work anymore, so coffee would spill everywhere if you wanted to pour a cup before it stopped brewing. This became a huge problem when the brewing began to take FOREVER after a couple more months. Also, the "clean" light has been on chronically, even when we've cleaned in the thing left and right, exactly as recommended. Our previous coffee maker lasted us 5 years, this one lasted us 8 months. Would return it if it seemed this was easier to do. Will just go back to the Krups brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: Used to have a Mr. Coffee with the carafe and detachable reservoir and we loved that one, but had to get a new one every 3 years because they started leaking. Spent the extra $40 on this one and don’t like it. Brews fairly slow, has a super annoying blue light display that you can’t adjust. Sprays out of the spout when you pour a cup, and the carafe doesn’t empty all the way! You have to shake it upside down to get all the coffee out. For a little more $$ I would just get a Bunn.
customer_reviews.author: KJC

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend purchasing this in white.  The coffee stains cannot be removed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Cuisinart 14 cup coffeemaker that I had for seven years which I used at least twice a day. I have great faith in the brand. I would definitely not purchase this unit in white again. I am disappointed in how easily it has stained and even using bleach, whether in the dishwasher or otherwise, the stains do not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our previous Cuisinart coffeemaker lasted for 8 years so we felt safe ordering another one. Well, this newest version has a bad design and it started leaking after 5 months. I'm not talking a dribble either - one day it worked and the next day half a carafe of water was on the counter. It costs quite a bit of money to get it replaced via the warranty (approx $30-40 shipping) so we're just tossing it. I'm disappointed that Cuisinart won't fix what is obviously a known problem, and won't replace it for free. :(
customer_reviews.author: CatLady27

customer_reviews.title: Great Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. You cannot remove the plastic coffee filter basket to wash it. Eventually, coffee grounds get into the basket and gather at the bottom where the water dispensing hole is. It is impossible to get the coffee grounds out and they end up in your fresh pot of coffee. Your is NOT good to the last drop. The instructions say to wipe down with a paper towel. I’m sorry I purchased this product. UPDATE: I contacted Cuisinart and you CAN remove the coffee filter basket to clean it. Note that this process is NOT included in the cleaning section of the booklet. Makes a GREAT cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 8 months. This was a replacement for the same item I had for several years with no issues. Now when I add the water to make coffee, it leaks out all over the countertop. Tried to ask for support, but evidently product support/replacement doesn't exist now? At last I can't find any. Now I need to replace it, & I'll just go with a cheap replacemnt this time, that makes coffee just as well without all the bells & whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This machine is loud!
customer_reviews.text: I am going to try to get this returned even though it's been six months. For a couple months now, the coffee maker makes an incredibly loud "clunking" sound as it brews. It's loud enough to wake us up in the morning even though our bedroom is on the other side of the house and upstairs. The coffee itself is fine, though on medium I would expect the temperature of the coffee in the carafe to be a bit hotter. The one star is for the quality of the machine itself and the unexplainable noise. Check out the video.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Makes hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: Was taking a chance with this machine after reading the negative and positive reviews. We've had problems with may machines over flowing the filter because of the amount of coffee grounds we use. Used the book's recommended amount of 15 tablespoons and watched the cycle before moving to 16+ and it makes very hot full flavor coffee using Folgers Black Silk. Reasonably easy to keep clean with just a wipe down and will save deeper cleaning while performing the required clean cycle. Even though we usually turn off the machine soon after its finished but also keep the warming plate on medium because another reviewer observed the plate pealing while always using the high setting.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Non refundable!
customer_reviews.text: I found the brewing time and the small..slow...drip to be unacceptable. Also...the water tank is not easy to fill or dump out of unused water to replace with fresh water. Have to dump the whole coffee pot. I must be doing something wrong! Anyway, drip time was biggest complaint. I never have trouble returning anything on Amazon...especially such a costly item....but when I attempted to...went all the way to obtain code or label...and then got the message....non refundable...Contact seller if you have an issue. I didn’t want to through any more with this pot..so I gave it to my SIster . Amazon should advise non refundable upfront!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Cappolino

customer_reviews.title: Broken after less than a year of use
customer_reviews.text: At first, I loved the design and functionality of this coffee machine purchased in early August 2019. It stopped brewing altogether without a warning in early June. Customer service instructed me to use the clean function, which I did with not much success as the machine would complete the maneuver after 3 minutes, even though the container with the cleaning mixture was still full. Emails to customer service were not answered, so I find myself unable to repair an item less than a year old. I'll never purchase from CuisineArt again.
customer_reviews.author: BookAnalyzer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My Mr. Coffee gave up the ghost. I thought I'd try this one after going through two Mr. Coffee over the years with a stainless steel carafe that keeps the coffee hot long after without heating. I went through their instruction of using with just water before first coffee use. I found it hard to fill in comparison with my other one. When the signal went off that it was done, I lifted the carafe out, and hot water went all over. There was still a lot of hot water on the top lid of the carafe which had not gotten into the container. I returned and ordered a Mr. Coffee. Never did use it for coffee.
customer_reviews.author: DanB

customer_reviews.title: Annoying design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisininart coffee maker makes good coffee. I like the option to choose bold setting. The coffee is hot when brewed, stays reasonably warm in the carafe. The problem, as others have stated, is when you pour the coffee. It always spills some coffee on the counter. Not a huge problem, but annoying. I hope Cuisinart will solve this problem in the next design. If anyone has found a solution, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sprays when pouring, poor flavor, defective, leaked
customer_reviews.text: There was a time when Cuisinart was a reliable and well performing brand. This coffee maker is cheaply made and gave up the ghost after 10 days. The flavor was weak. I also recently discarded my year old Cuisinart Toaster oven which stopped operating properly. I will not buy any Cuisinart small appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Warning! It is taller than 14"!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker! Except that the measurements say 14" tall, it is not! It's closer to 14.25" and won't fit in my garage which is 14"! If the ad would have said the exact dimension I wouldn't be shopping again for one that fits! FYI! When shopping for a coffee maker, viewing the dimensions that are listed on the product description, you will see that there is no consistency when the manufacturer lays out the dimension. It should be H x W x D! Apparently there is no standard, so be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: How hard can it be?
customer_reviews.text: There's not a lot of positive here. There's a lot of neutral, and one BIG negative. The neutral - It makes coffee. It looks OK. The big negative - the horribly-designed pour spout! You can't pour coffee (or water if filling) without it going everywhere. Try pouring slow, try pouring fast - heck, make a drinking game out of it where you take a drink every time you you pour and coffee/water goes everywhere. How hard can it be to design a pour spout? Everyone else can do it. Even other models of the same brand do it. Find the person who designed the pour spout and fire them. Ridiculous, really.
customer_reviews.author: Brent L. Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: I was worried in buying this. I purchased DCC-3200, there were so many mixed reviews and plenty of them were bad ones but I’m glad I Went for it and bought it. I had no leaking issues. The warming plate works well, had no issues with that rusting as others have said. I’m able to pour the water in easily...don’t really understand why people are complaining about that. As for the coffee, it comes out nice and hot and the flavor is great 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: osiris

customer_reviews.title: AFTER ONLY 3 MONTHS OF USE, IT LEAKED ALL OVER MY KITCHEN COUNTER
customer_reviews.text: Love the coffee pot because I can control the carafe temperature, set to make coffee before I wake up and will make 14 cups! BUT not too happy with the Cuisinart Co. After the water leaked OUT of the coffee pot the other morning and went all over my counter and even in a drawer, their only response was to send me another because it's under warranty but have me pay 10.00 shipping and the cost to ship the old coffee pot cord to Arizona! I complained that was not acceptable * they finally agreed to waive the 10.00 shipping if I would pay to ship cord. Better than nothing I guess. BUT, no apologies and anything.
customer_reviews.author: lazyrivergirl

customer_reviews.title: Coffee maker keeps on brewing!
customer_reviews.text: My trusty Cuisinart 12-cup drip coffee maker finally died after more than 10 years of steady use. It was the first coffeemaker that lasted me more than a year or two. So I considered replacing it with another one, but after reading reviews and complaints, I opted for the 14-cup coffee maker. It had fewer complaints from users. If it last as long as my old coffee maker, I'll be quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Practical problems, design defects, returning product
customer_reviews.text: 1. Opening the lid after the brewing is done causes water to drip down the back. Water leaking over an electrical cord is too much stress for me to deal with. I saw the water leaking issues in the reviews but thought maybe it's just a few units. Stupid design Cuisinart. 2. Re-seating the pot after serving yourself a cup is a struggle - it slipped right in only the first few days, a week tops. Now, 90% of the time, you have to push hard (like a stuck door or window) and then it lands with a loud thud. Decided to return the product while I still can.
customer_reviews.author: dingbat

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to love this coffee maker. But, it was hard and awkward to fill the machine with water. It’s also hard to view the water fill line on the side because you are pouring water from the front. The carafe did keep the coffee warm, but if there were leftover coffee, there is no way to heat the coffee without making a fresh pot. I returned this item and purchased a different brand and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Anne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent So Far
customer_reviews.text: The best coffee maker we have ever had. Simple to use. The unique thermal canister keeps the coffee hot for about two hours, which is more than enough for us. The canister is a bit on the heavy side, but not a problem. The canister does pour slowly, and is hard to get it totally empty. High quality design. Seems to be high quality construction, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Woody54

customer_reviews.title: Another piece of garbage made in China that broke in under 2 years. NOT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: This made great coffee until It didn’t. I bough this coffee maker a little under 2 years ago. And now it completely leaked all over the counters and won’t work. Also impossible to get a hold of someone at Cuisinart for a new coffee machine or a refund or replacement parts. Or anything helpful at all. Who in their right mind has the time to sit on the phone for hours or days on hold to figure out what to do next??!!! $100 is not cheap. Would be nice if it held up for longer than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Svetty Mar

customer_reviews.title: Good coffeemaker, if you accommodate idiosyncracies
customer_reviews.text: Better design than the earlier 12-cup "extreme brew" model. Same idiosyncracies, though. Do not use too fine a grain and try to make a full pot or you will have an overflow. Coarse ground is more forgiving. Do not use the scale on the carafe for planning purposes. 14 cups on the coffeemaker will give you 14 cups of coffee, but 14 cups on the carafe will give you 12 cups of coffee. Finally, the notion of "cups" is totally fanciful....don't use it for cooking! When will America join the rest of the world and use metric units? :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jean Bernard Minster

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Cuisinart Coffeemaker, Both Died Within Two Years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine.....twice.... because of the positive reviews figuring I must have gotten a lemon the first time. Here I am again 20 months later with the same coffeemaker that doesn't work for the same reason. It won't pump the water through to the unit. It sits there forever and belches bursts of loud steam that sounds like the thing is going to explode! I have only used filtered water. That's exactly what the first unit did as well. Now it's back to researching and (gasp) I think I'm going to try the Ninja model. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: D. ATWELL

customer_reviews.title: Just Bad Tasting Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Try as I might I could not get this to make good tasting coffee. I even used an excellent type of coffee that usually brews to an amazing taste, and used reverse osmosis water which is the best. At first the rewed coffee tasted weak and plastic-y. After contacting Cuisinart I followed their advice and cleaned the pot with vinegar/water, as directed, and made sure to run several plain water rrinse brews before I tried to brew coffee again. Unfortunately, the taste was still watery and burnt. Thankfully, after many hours lost, Amazon made sure I got a refund. Conclusion: ... the great taste reviews this pot gets did not work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn’t!
customer_reviews.text: We reluctantly bought this new coffee maker when our beloved Krup’s maker died after 12 years of faithful service. This Cuisinart lasted exactly 1 year to the day. I made a pot of coffee this morning only to find half the reservoir of hot water trailing down my countertop and pooling onto my hardwood floors. It is leaking from the bottom of the machine, like a seal has been compromised. Although it has a three year warranty, I’m not sure I want to pay shipping both ways and take a chance on another machine that will probably be a refurb.
customer_reviews.author: TheSweetpickles

customer_reviews.title: This is a very difficult coffee pot to use
customer_reviews.text: The water reservoir is impossible to fill without spilling. We like our coffee bold. If you add enough coffee to make a rich pot of coffee the grounds spill over into the pot. You have to preform a second filtering of the coffee to avoid grounds in your cup. Additionally, the clean up of the pot takes a lot of time. We purchased this pot because of the stainless steel carafe but would not recommend it or purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Nana362

customer_reviews.title: Yes we like them... We own 3 of them!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, we have one for the house, one for the lake house and one at hubby's work. I will admit one of the models has the 12 cup thermal carafe but we prefer the 14 cup glass carafe because it's easier to see if there is coffee left and they are easier to empty all the coffee out of. The thermal carafe has a special lid which makes it a little more difficult to pour all the coffee out. Overall, love them!
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: BEST coffee I have EVER made!
customer_reviews.text: I used the same beans that I used in my older coffee pot, but WOW what a difference this coffeemaker makes! I have to say I was swooning over the flavor. I did not expect much so I was really surprised. You can set the heat on high and the flavor is not affected by that. It is simple to use which is a big plus for me. You cannot go wrong no matter what your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: cynthiab

customer_reviews.title: Not Working??
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Coffee Maker in September. It worked great! We loved it. Yesterday it wouldn’t brew any coffee. I cleaned it, installed a new water filter and still not working. The power is on, the blue clock light is lite and the clock is working. However non of the control bottoms do anything??? I called Amazon support, spoke with a very nice lady but only reviewed the installations with me. She connected me with Manufacture. She said they will call me back within 12 hours. There is no reset button and no apparent way to reset it???Amazon is great selling items, now I will see how they are at fixing them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Global American Enterprises Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible carafe design
customer_reviews.text: While it brews a good cup of coffee, the carafe design is such that coffee spills all over once you have poured approximately 80% of the coffee. The reason is that you have to turn the carafe practically upside down due to a ring under the spout. In addition, there is no easy way to clean the inside of the carafe given the very narrow opening. The worst Cuisinart product I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK ALBARRACIN

customer_reviews.title: No issues or problems so far
customer_reviews.text: It's only been a few months but I am very hard on coffee makers... about three full uses every day! This one was easy to set up and is easy to use. It may be a local thing but I have never had it complain about the water filters or needing to be cleaned. I clean it and change the filter every month anyway but that is still 90-100 pots of coffee. I usually wear out the heating elements and they stop pumping water after about a year... so it's too early to tell how long this one will last.
customer_reviews.author: PAP

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 4/9/18 - leaking all over cabinet 10/18
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it started leaking everywhere 6 months in. Placed order for silicone tubing today to attempt repair. Is such a big issue that there are repair videos on line and even links to the tubing to buy on Amazon. Is a little difficult to set up, so will need the instructions. I don't like that I can't set the burner shutoff time at more than 4 hrs. Also, if sleepy like me and occasionally forget to put the lid on the carafe, the part where the grounds are will overflow which I managed to do a couple of times:) Everything else worked perfectly. Just the durability stinks to high heaven.
customer_reviews.author: alisha bumpass

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this, it spills every time you use it.
customer_reviews.text: The design of the carafe really lets this coffee maker down. It is nearly impossible to pour water from the carafe into the machine without spilling due to the continuous rim in front of the spout. This same design flaw makes getting the last half cup of coffee out of the pot with the lid on messy. The rim prevents the last measure of coffee coming out the spot and instead it will come out the fill hole. I have never been so irritated with a coffee maker, especially one this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan J Fine

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use, great for daily drinkers
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. I was looking for something simple and easy to use that would brew a lot of coffee. It looks nice on my counter and is easy to clean and use. Some of my favorite features: -the timer, in case I want to set my coffee up the night before -the bold button, if you want extra strong coffee -the 1-4 cup button, when you're making coffee just for yourself! -the carafe temp button, if you like your coffee super hot or on the warmer side I drink a lot of coffee and this is one of the best coffee makers you can purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw causes spills with each use
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the stainless steel thermal pot. It makes good coffee but the pot has a design flaw that causes messes every time you use it. The thermal pot is difficult to pour out of. As you get down to the last few cups, you virtually have to turn the pot upside down. This causes spills while pouring water into the reservoir and also when pouring coffee. I kept it for 10 days and every time it was used, it caused spills. On two occasions the filter over flowed and there were coffee grounds in the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: So FAR ; great machine.
customer_reviews.text: ONLY design suggestion would be is to utilize a LED to tell you when brewing has completed. This maker emits a BEEP when it's through brewing, well if you're away from the kitchen, you don't truly know if it's done when you return....but hey...if it's NOT done dripping is one tell tale sign....LOL... But, I can truly say, by the design of the basket...I DEFINITELY USE LESS coffee than any other make in the past ....GREAT coffee maker. IT is a little pricey but you get what you pay for.! I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: returning Cuisinart buyer
customer_reviews.text: My old Cuisinart failed. As others show, internal the maker. BUT, the fail was after more than 10 years. So, I believe that is a fair lifetime. And, this new product is better. 12 vs 10 cups. the carafe does not 'wee' all over the place like the old one, and has more stainless on the maker and carafe. The new one has been flawless out of the box and in use. And, IMO, better looking than the posted photos. I did go over and over reviews of numerous competitor coffee makers. Super happy with the decision to stay with Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: JCF

customer_reviews.title: This is the best coffee maker I've had in years!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box, I loved the styling. The Amazon page on this includes a brief, yet very informative video from the manufacturer. This takes a few minutes more to brew than the other brand I used for 30 years (rhymes with Sun!) That is not a big deal, though, I can pull the pot out pausing the brew, and fill my mug.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great durability!  Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these exact same coffee makers. I bought the last one four years ago and never had any problems with it until something sprung a leak around Christmas. I did my usual research - checking reviews at several sites, and was surprised to see this model still in production and still consistently the highest rated coffee maker. It makes great coffee, the timers work great and I find it doesn’t burn the coffee when I reheat on the 4-cup setting. I get about three days off one pot of coffee and the last cup is as good as the first!
customer_reviews.author: EagleTRL

customer_reviews.title: Great a Coffee but Terrible design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I loved the coffee maker but it has a fatal flaw. The valve that shuts off the flow of coffee from the basket to carafe is held on by a flimsy thin plastic washer. Mine came off and was lost the second time I used the machine. The replacement arrived and broke when I was washing it - before it was used. Fix that flaw and this machine is great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I guess things just don't last very long these days.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffeemaker in June of 2019. I have been a fan of Cuisinart for many years. This morning this one bit the dust. An expensive lesson to learn @ $70.00 I thought it would have lasted much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Haines

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, pour handling.
customer_reviews.text: Overall very pleased with this coffee maker. However, the carafe is a different matter. While it does a good job of keeping the coffee hot, when pouring the last several cups (2-3) it always splatters and makes a mess. Keep napkins handy.
customer_reviews.author: The Hub

customer_reviews.title: ... only make 12 cups at a time unless you like weaker tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Can only make 12 cups at a time unless you like weaker tasting coffee . When using enough grounds for 14 cups, the grounds overflow the filter. Coffee is smooth but not as flavorful as the previous Krups. Same water/grounds ratio. Rookie design flaw--- when opening the lid after brewing coffee, the condensation runs down the back of the unit. If your going to use the "bold" button, push it FIRST before pushing the "brew" button. Didn't see that info in the book. Didn't buy another Krups as they only last the warranty period plus a week.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Better hope it works out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Received shipment today. Power cord cut into two pieces. Amazon refused to replace it and instead told me I had to contact the manufacturer to honor the 1-year warranty IN SPITE OF THE FACT IT WAS DAMAGED ON RECEIPT. This order was to have replaced the same model we had for 2-3 years that finally bit the dust. Liked the product but not the support from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dale G. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: A perfect cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Best brewed coffee after 40 years of searching. Grind my own beans, but either struggle with percolating for more flavor, or drip for convenience. This drip coffee maker hits the sweet spot with the Bold option. I love that button. * Hot enough (Less than boiling) * Carafe keeps it hot for about 2 hours. * Auto start timer is convenient. One noticeable negative is the brightness of the clock. I don't need a reading light in the kitchen. But... in the end, a perfect cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Macaluso

customer_reviews.title: The carafe is my problem
customer_reviews.text: Overall the machine works well and produces a good tasting cup of coffee. Now, the problem with the devise is the carafe. The spout needs to be re-engineered, it is difficult to pour coffee into a cup without spilling some of the coffee. For some reason, as one is pouring, part of the fluid runs down the body of the carafe and drips unto the table, or whatever the cup is setting on. Having said that, the carafe keeps the coffee hot for well over an hour, perhaps a couple of hours. Bottom line is always have a napkin handy to clean up the mess. That's my story and I'm sticking to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: No good coffee; carafe sticks to the burner; suuuuper slow to brew.  BIG FAT BOO
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this coffee maker. I'm very disappointed. The coffee is not rich nor dark, despite filling the basket and hitting the BOLD setting. Just as some as other reviewers mentioned, the carafe sticks to the burner - so much so that I was concerned several times that I would break the glass carafe. I am meticulous clean and certain to wipe the bottom of the carafe and the burner before starting. Water does leak out of the bottom onto the burner (requiring another wipe down) when filling the reservoir. Finally, it's crazy slow brew. Timed 3 mornings in a row: 16-17 minutes for a full pot. VERY UNHAPPY with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately coffee maker arrived dented.
customer_reviews.text: I've had an exact duplicate of this coffee maker which I really liked but it died unexpectedly a couple of weeks ago. I'm very disappointed in this one as it arrived dented. Packaging was not damaged so I have to assume it came from the factory like this or was repackaged before shipping to me. It is not an exactly cheap coffee maker so this is a big disappointment. Since I live in a rural area of Alaska with limited shopping that is currently exacerbated by the pandemic, I will plan on keeping it unless it doesn't brew tomorrow morning.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaheaven

customer_reviews.title: Coffee's Hot
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a real expert on coffee, so the flavor of the coffee for me depends more on the brand and the blend than the maker itself, and so I would rate this maker with 5 stars. Pouring the water into the tank is awkward because the lid prevents one from emptying the carafe completely—but it's close. Buttons are easy to read, and clock is easily set, both for the current time and for a delayed start. Just make sure you're setting the clock and delay brew for AM or PM. I have no comment as to its longevity. At this point, I would recommend this unit to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: jmariner

customer_reviews.title: Best brand ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee pot to replace my last one, which was a cuisinart.....it was 13 years old.
customer_reviews.author: maria j.

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this coffee pot after having a BUN for years. I got this because it can be programmed to auto brew in the morning. I also really wanted a pause feature so I could pour my coffee as it is brewing. My other pot had overflow issues this one does not. I like the placement and ease of the coffee filter. Taste and temp is great. Compared to my BUN it does take a little longer to brew, but perfectly fine because you can program it the night before to start brewing before waking up. Obviously I want my coffee ASAP lol
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased at this point.
customer_reviews.text: It came in looking really nice and packed well. Cleaned it as others suggested and no plastic taste. The tone is loud as some complained about. You can shut that off. The flavor gets better the more we use it. I am impressed so far and hope the plate does not rust and peel as the one gentleman described. It replaced my old maker, 1200.
customer_reviews.author: Kay White

customer_reviews.title: 1-month old and broken
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a new coffee pot for our home. After five weeks it does not brew. We tried unplugging it for 15 minutes to let it reset, but still not brewing. When pressing the Brew button, the pot makes noise but no brew.
customer_reviews.author: topdog

customer_reviews.title: Bought it May 8th, it broke two months later
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Cuisinart drip coffee maker for years, loved it. Got this one in May and it' doesn't work at all, two months later. It started with the water not going all the way through and coffee grounds everywhere. After several attempts of just testing it with water, the water doesn't go through to the carafe at all. It beeps after a minute as if it's done. We are passed the 30 days to return to Amazon, when we called Cusinart, they suggested decalcification,. Oh sure, that's the issue. We haven't finished trying to resolve it, but wanted to warn people right away.
customer_reviews.author: James P Herlihy

customer_reviews.title: This is made in China.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to Google Cuisinart to determine place of manufacture. I didn't find any information other than Cuisinart is a U.S. manufacture. I've really liked their products in the past, but "Made in China" is now a deal breaker for me. Sorry Cuisinart, but I won't be purchasing your products as long as they are "Made in China".
customer_reviews.author: R.L.DeLong

customer_reviews.title: It's advertised as a 12 cop coffee maker, but only holds 10 cups of water.
customer_reviews.text: This is so bizarre, but this only holds 10 cups of water. I've tried multiple measuring cups because it just seems so strange that it would say 12 cups, but it only holds 10 cups in the coffee maker. Plus I've measured how much water the carafe holds and you can't even get a full 10 cups in it before it's overflowing. Coffee is fine, but that's hugely irritating since we bought this to get more coffee out of every pot.
customer_reviews.author: KarenP

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality only worked 1.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in December 2018. It is now June 2020. All was working fine and it was a great coffee pot till this morning when water started leaking out of the tank. Our last Cuisinart coffee maker lasted for 12 years. This one didnt even make it 2 years. So disappointed. It did work well up until today. I guess Cuisinart has lost its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sin City

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t drip!!
customer_reviews.text: I have NEVER had a coffee machine/carafe that didn’t drip (unless you held it at a certain angle) when filling the reservoir or pouring coffee. It may sound silly but this was almost the best thing about this purchase. Every other machine I had was so annoying because water ran down the carafe onto the counter when pouring. The coffee itself is great and the warming plate stays on for a sufficient amount of time. It looks really nice, not cheap, and it’s easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: dachausbau

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality, rugged, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The stainless steel insulated carafe is new to us. The lid rotates to come off, and rinsing a couple of times gives clear water, so cleaning out the old coffee is easier than a glass carafe which doesn't rinse so efficiently. A permanent filter is included, something we bought separately for all our older coffeemakers. Things I would like to see improved include are mainly an easier way to empty a carafe of clean water into the reservoir, and an indicator that tells when the coffee heater has timed out.
customer_reviews.author: Typical Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hottest cup of delicious brewed coffee you’ll ever enjoy.
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my new coffee maker! I had not had a good hot cup of brewed coffee at home in years. After my last coffee maker died I went with the Keurig trend (which I regretted). I upgraded to a Nespresso Machine with I do LOVE however, Nespresso machines can’t brew a pot of coffee. I did. A little reading on reviews and consumer reports etc which lead me to the Cuisinart having the functions I most preferred with my number 1 being a hot pot of coffee. The pad settings make that possible. Not to mention, my coffee is delicious!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
